original: candasāṅgirasvaditi diśo haitadyajuretadvai viśve devā vaiśvānarā eṣu🔽lokeṣūkhāyāmetena caturthena yajuṣā diśo 'dadhustathaivaitadyajamāna eṣu
analyzed: candasā aṅgirasvat iti diśaḥ ha etat yajuḥ etat vai viśve devāḥ vaiśvānarāḥ eṣu  lokeṣu ukhāyām etena caturthena yajuṣā diśaḥ dadhuḥ tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ eṣu
translated: 'May the all-gods, the Vaisvânaras, make thee by means of the Anushtubh metre, after the manner of Angiras.'--This Yagus-formula, doubtless, is the quarters; and the all-gods, the Vaisvânaras, are these worlds;

original: lokeṣūkhāyāmetena caturthena yajuṣā diśo dadhātyaṅgirasvaditi prāṇo vā aṅgirā
analyzed: lokeṣu ukhāyām etena caturthena yajuṣā diśaḥ dadhāti aṅgirasvat iti prāṇaḥ vai aṅgirāḥ
translated: and by means of that fourth Yagus-formula they placed the quarters in these worlds in the pan; and in like manner the sacrificer now, by means of that fourth Yagus-formula, places the quarters in these worlds in the pan. 'After the manner of Angiras,' he says; for Angiras is the breath.

original: dhruvāsīti sthirāsītyetadatho pratiṣṭhitāsīti diśo 'sīti diśo hyetadyajurdhārayā mayi
analyzed: dhruvā asi iti sthirā asi iti etat atha u pratiṣṭhitā asi iti diśaḥ si iti diśaḥ hi etat yajuḥ dhārayā mayi
translated: 'Thou art firm,'--that is, 'thou art stable,' or 'thou art established;'--'thou art the regions,'--the regions, doubtless, are this Yagus-formula;--'uphold in me!'

original: prajāṃ rāyaspoṣaṃ gaupatyaṃ suvīryaṃ sajātānyajamānāyetyetadvai viśve devā
analyzed: prajām rāyaspoṣam gaupatyam su vīryam sajātān yajamānāya iti etat vai viśve devāḥ
translated: 'Thou art firm', he says; that means 'thou art stable', or 'thou art established'. 'Thou art the quarters', he says; for this Yajus is the quarters. 'Support offspring, increase of wealth, lordship of cattle, good manhood, kinsmen for the sacrificer', he says. The All-gods

original: vaiśvānarā diśaḥ kṛtvā tāsvetāmāśiṣamāśāsata tathaivaitadyajamāno diśaḥ kṛtvā
analyzed: vaiśvānarāḥ diśaḥ kṛtvā tāsu etām āśiṣam āśāsata tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ diśaḥ kṛtvā
translated: having made the quarters, invoked this blessing in them; in the same way the sacrificer, having made the quarters,

analyzed: tāsu etām āśiṣam āśāste
translated: invokes this blessing in them.

analyzed: tena etena antarataḥ ca bāhyatas ca karoti
translated: With this he makes (the altar) both inside and outside;

analyzed: tasmāt eṣām lokānām antarataḥ ca bāhyatas ca
translated: therefore (the altar) is both inside and outside of these worlds.

analyzed: diśā parimitam etena karoti aparimitāḥ hi diśaḥ
translated: With this (he makes) the quarters unlimited, for the quarters are unlimited.

original: tām prādeśamātrīmevordhvāṃ karoti /🔽prādeśamātrīṃ tiraścīm prādeśamātro vai
analyzed: tām prādeśa mātrīm eva ūrdhvām karoti  prādeśa mātrīm tiraścīm prādeśa mātraḥ vai
translated: He makes it one span high.

analyzed: garbhaḥ viṣṇuḥ yoniḥ eṣā garbha sammitām tat yonim karoti
translated: One span is the embryo, Vishnu; this (altar) is the womb. He makes the womb equal to the embryo.

analyzed: sā yadi varṣīyasī prādeśāt syāt
translated: If it is larger than one span,

analyzed: etena yajuṣā hrasīyasīm kuryāt yadi hrasīyasī etena
translated: he should make it smaller with this Yajus; if it is smaller,

analyzed: varṣīyasīm  sa yadi ekaḥ paśuḥ syāt
translated: with this (Yajus he should make it) larger.🔽If there is one animal,

original: ekaprādeśāṃ kuryādatha yadi pañca paśavaḥ syuḥ
analyzed: eka prādeśām kuryāt atha yadi pañca paśavaḥ syuḥ
translated: he should make it one span; if there are five animals,

original: pañcaprādeśāṃ kuryādiṣumātrīṃ vā vīryaṃ vā iṣuvīryaṃsammitaiva tadbhavati
analyzed: pañca prādeśām kuryāt iṣu mātrīm vā vīryam vai iṣu vīryam sammitā eva tat bhavati
translated: He should make it five cubits long, or a cubit long; the strength of the arrow is equal to the strength of a man; it is thus commensurate.

analyzed: pañca prādeśā ha sma tu eva purā iṣuḥ bhavati
translated: The arrow is indeed five cubits long.

analyzed: atha tiraścīm rāsnām paryasyati
translated: He then turns the cord crosswise (from left to right).

original: diśo haiva saitadvai devā imāṃlokānukhāṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: diśaḥ ha eva sā etat vai devāḥ imān lokān ukhām kṛtvā
translated: For the cord is indeed the quarters. The gods, having made these worlds a pan,

analyzed: digbhiḥ adṛṃhan digbhiḥ paryatanvan tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ imān lokān ukhām kṛtvā
translated: strengthened them by the quarters, they surrounded them by the quarters; and in like manner does the Sacrificer, having made these worlds a pan,

analyzed: digbhiḥ dṛṃhati digbhiḥ paritanoti
translated: strengthen them by the quarters, surround them by the quarters.

analyzed: tām uttare vitṛtīye paryasyati
translated: He turns it on the north side, in the third layer.

analyzed: atra ha eṣām lokānām antāḥ samāyanti
translated: For here the ends of these worlds meet;

analyzed: tat eva enān tat dūṃhati
translated: there he thus strengthens them.

analyzed: adityai rāsnā asi iti
translated: 'Thou art the cord of Aditi,' (with these words he lays down the cord);

analyzed: varuṇyā vai yajñe rajjuḥ a varuṇyām eva enām etat rāsnām kṛtvā  paryasyati
translated: for the cord in the sacrifice belongs to Varuna; having made that cord of Varuna, he turns it.

analyzed: atha catasraḥ ūrdhvāḥ karoti
translated: He then makes four (other) (vertical) cords, silently.

original: tūṣṇīmeva diśo haiva tā etadvai devā imāṃlokānukhāṃ
analyzed: tūṣṇīm eva diśaḥ ha eva tāḥ etat vai devāḥ imān lokān ukhām
translated: For the cords are indeed the quarters. The gods, having made these worlds a pan,

original: kṛtvā digbhiḥ sarvato 'dṛṃhaṃstathaivaitadyajamāna imāṃlokānukhāṃ kṛtvā digbhiḥ
analyzed: kṛtvā digbhiḥ sarvatas dṛṃhan tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ imān lokān ukhām kṛtvā digbhiḥ
translated: strengthened them on all sides by the quarters; and in like manner the Sacrificer, having made these worlds a pan,

analyzed: sarvatas dṛṃhati 🔽tāḥ etāḥ ā etasyai bhavanti
translated: strengthens them on all sides by the quarters.

analyzed: etat vai etāḥ etām astabhnuvaḥ tathā eva enām etat stabhnuvanti
translated: for they then supported her, and in like manner do they now support her.

original: tadyadata ūrdhvaṃ tadetayā tiraścyā dṛḍhamatha yadato 'rvāktadetābhiḥ / / /
analyzed: tat yat atas ūrdhvam tat etayā tiraścyā dṛḍham atha yat atas rvāc tat etābhiḥ
translated: And what is above that (altar) is firmly supported by that cross-line, and what is below that (altar) is by these (other lines).

original: tāsāmagreṣu stanānunnayanti /🔽etadvai devā imāṃlokānukhāṃ kṛtvaitai stanaiḥ
analyzed: tāsām agreṣu stanān unnayanti  etat vai devāḥ imān lokān ukhām kṛtvā etaiḥ stanaiḥ
translated: They first raise the teats (of the cow).

analyzed: sarvān kāmān aduhata tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ imān lokān ukhām kṛtvā etaiḥ stanaiḥ  sarvān kāmān duhai
translated: For the gods, having made these worlds into a cow, milked all their desires from her with those teats; and in like manner does the Sacrificer, having made these worlds into a cow, now milk all his desires from her with those teats.

analyzed: sā eṣā gauḥ eva
translated: He milks her in the same order in which the gods did.🔽That cow is this (earth).

original: ime vai lokā ukheme lokā gaustasyā etadūdho yaiṣā tiraścī rāsnā sā
analyzed: ime vai lokāḥ ukhā ime lokāḥ gauḥ tasyāḥ etat ūdhar yā eṣā tiraścī rāsnā sā
translated: These worlds are the udder of that cow, and that cross-line is her teat.

analyzed: vitṛtīye bhavati vitṛtīye hi gorūdhaḥ
translated: It is in the third (layer), for the teat of the cow is in the third (part of her body).

analyzed: tasyai stanān unnayati
translated: He raises the teats (of the cow).

original: ūdhasastatstanānunnayati sā catustanā bhavati catustanā hi🔽gauḥ / / /
analyzed: ūdhasaḥ tat stanān unnayati sā catur stanā bhavati catur stanā hi  gauḥ
translated: He raises them from the udder, and it has four teats, for the cow has four teats.

original: tāṃ haike dvistanāṃ kurvanti /🔽atho aṣṭastanāṃ na tathā kuryādye vai goḥ
analyzed: tām ha eke dvi stanām kurvanti  atha u aṣṭa stanām na tathā kuryāt ye vai goḥ
translated: Some make it have two teats,

original: kanīyastanāḥ paśavo ye bhūyastanā anupajīvanīyatarā vā asyaite 'nupajīvanīyatarāṃ
analyzed: kanīyaḥ stanāḥ paśavaḥ ye bhūyaḥ stanāḥ anupajīvanīyatarāḥ vai asya ete nupajīvanīyatarām
translated: and some eight teats. Let him not do so. Those animals which have fewer teats than the cow, and those which have more, are less useful to him; and those which are less useful he should not make more useful.

original: haināṃ te kurvate 'tho ha te na gāṃ kurvate śunīṃ vāviṃ vā vaḍabāṃ vā tasmāttathā
analyzed: ha enām te kurvate tho ha te na gām kurvate śunīm vā avim vā vaḍabām vā tasmāt tathā
translated: they make it small for him, and they do not make it big for him, either a bitch, or a ewe, or a mare; therefore (it is so).

original: na kuryāt / / /🔽athāsyai bilamabhipadyate /🔽aditiṣṭe bilaṃ gṛbhṇātviti vāgvā aditiretadvā enāṃ devāḥ
analyzed: na kuryāt  atha asyai bilam abhipadyate  aditiḥ te bilam gṛbhṇātu iti vāc vai aditiḥ etat vai enām devāḥ
translated: They make it small for him, and they do not make it big for him, either a bitch, or a ewe, or a mare: therefore he should not do so.

original: kṛtvā vācādityā niraṣṭhāpayaṃstathaivaināmayametatkṛtvā vācādityā niṣṭhāpayati / / /🔽tām parigṛhya nidadhāti /🔽kṛtvāya sā mahīmukhāmiti kṛtvāya sā🔽mahatīmukhāmityetanmṛnmayīṃ yonimagnaya iti mṛnmayī hyeṣā yoniragneḥ🔽putrebhyaḥ prāyacadaditiḥ śrapayānityetadvā enāmaditiḥ kṛtvā devebhyaḥ putrebhyaḥ
analyzed: kṛtvā vācā adityā niraṣṭhāpayan tathā eva enām ayam etat kṛtvā vācā adityā niṣṭhāpayati  tām parigṛhya nidadhāti  kṛtvāya sā mahī mukhām iti kṛtvāya sā  mahatīm ukhām iti etat mṛd mayīm yonim agnaye iti mṛd mayī hi eṣā yoniḥ agneḥ  putrebhyaḥ prāyacat aditiḥ śrapayān iti etat vai enām aditiḥ kṛtvā devebhyaḥ putrebhyaḥ
translated: Then he approaches the hole of it (the pan), with, 'May Aditi seize thy hole!' Aditi is speech: having made it (the pan) into speech, the gods then established it; and in like manner does this one now, having made it into speech, establish it by means of speech.🔽Having seized it, he puts it down, with, 'Having made it, the great-mouthed (pan),'--that is, 'having made it, the great-mouthed (pan),'--'the clay womb of Agni,'--for that (pan) is indeed the clay womb of Agni;--'Aditi gave to her sons for baking,'--for in like manner as Aditi, having made it, gave it to the gods, her sons, for baking, so does this one now, having made it, give it to the gods for baking.

original: śrapaṇāya prāyacattathaivaināmayametatkṛtvā devebhyaḥ śrapaṇāya prayacati / / /🔽tā haike tisraḥ kurvanti /🔽trayo vā ime lokā ime lokā ukhā iti vadanto 'tho anyo
analyzed: śrapaṇāya prāyacat tathā eva enām ayam etat kṛtvā devebhyaḥ śrapaṇāya prayacati  tāḥ ha eke tisraḥ kurvanti  trayaḥ vai ime lokāḥ ime lokāḥ ukhāḥ iti vadantaḥ
translated: He then makes it into a lump, with, 'The lump of earth, the great-mouthed (pan),'--that is, 'the lump of earth, the great-mouthed (pan),'--'the clay womb of Agni,'--for that (pan) is indeed the clay womb of Agni;--'Aditi gave to her sons for baking,'--for in like manner as Aditi, having made it, gave it to the gods, her sons, for baking, so does this one now, having made it, give it to the gods for baking.

analyzed: nyasyai prāyaścityai yadi itarā bhetsyate thā itarasyām bhariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Some make three (of those lumps), saying, 'There are these three worlds, and the pan is these worlds.' But others, for the atonement of each (pan), say, 'If the other one should break, we will put it into the other one.'

original: yadītarāthetarasyāmiti na tathā kuryādyo vā eṣa nidhiḥ prathamo 'yaṃ sa loko yaḥ
analyzed: yadi itarā atha itarasyām iti na tathā kuryāt yaḥ vai eṣa nidhiḥ prathamaḥ yam sa lokaḥ yaḥ
translated: If one were to do so, it would not be right. Or, if this first treasure is this world,

original: pūrva uddhirantarikṣaṃ tadya uttaro dyauḥ sātha yadetaccaturthaṃ yajurdiśo haiva
analyzed: pūrvaḥ uddhiḥ antarikṣam tat yaḥ uttaraḥ dyauḥ sā atha yat etat caturtham yajuḥ diśaḥ ha eva
translated: the first raised one is the atmosphere. The second is the sky. And if this fourth Yajus is the quarters,

original: tadetāvadvā idaṃ sarva yāvadime ca lokā diśaśca sa yadatropāharedati tadrecayedyadu🔽vai yajñe'tiriktaṃ kriyate yajamānasya taddviṣantam bhrātṛvyamabhyatiricyate yadu
analyzed: tat etāvat vai idam sarva yāvat ime ca lokāḥ diśaḥ ca sa yat atra upāharet ati tat recayet yat u  vai yajña itiriktam kriyate yajamānasya tat dviṣantam bhrātṛvyam abhyatiricyate yat u
translated: this is all that there is, as far as these worlds and the quarters. If he were to put anything here, he would exceed it.🔽Whatever is done in excess in the sacrifice, that exceeds the sacrificer's enemy.

analyzed: bhinnāyai prāyaścittiḥ uttarasmin tad anvākhyāne
translated: The expiation for a broken (sacrifice) is in the following section.

original: tasyā etasyā aṣāḍhām pūrvāṃ karoti /🔽iyaṃ vā aṣāḍheyamu vā eṣāṃ lokānām
analyzed: tasyāḥ etasyāḥ aṣāḍhām pūrvām karoti  iyam vai aṣāḍhā iyam u vai eṣām lokānām
translated: Of that (sacrifice) she makes the first one invincible.

original: prathamāsṛjyata tāmetasyā eva mṛdaḥ karotyeṣāṃ hyeva lokānāmiyam mahiṣī karoti
analyzed: prathamā asṛjyata tām etasyāḥ eva mṛdaḥ karoti yeṣām hi eva lokānām iyam mahiṣī karoti
translated: The invincible one is this (earth), for she was created first of these worlds. She makes it of the same clay as that (earth), for this (earth) is of these worlds. She makes it a cow,

original: mahiṣī hīyaṃ tadyaiva prathamā vittā sā mahiṣī / / /
analyzed: mahiṣī hi iyam tat yā eva prathamā vittā sā mahiṣī
translated: for this (earth) is a cow. That same (earth) which was first thought of is the cow.

original: pādamātrī bhavati /🔽pratiṣṭhā vai pāda iyamu vai pratiṣṭhā tryālikhitā bhavati
analyzed: pāda mātrī bhavati  pratiṣṭhā vai pādaḥ iyam u vai pratiṣṭhā tri ālikhitā bhavati
translated: It is a foot in size.🔽A foot is a foundation, and this (earth) is a foundation. It is marked with three lines,

analyzed: trivṛt hi iyam
translated: for this (earth) is threefold.

analyzed: atha ukhām karoti
translated: Then he makes a trough.

original: imāṃstallokānkarotyatha viśvajyotiṣaḥ karotyetā devatā agniṃ🔽vāyumādityametā hyeva devatā viśvaṃ jyotistā etasyā eva mṛdaḥ🔽karotyebhyastallokebhya etāndevānnirmimīte yajamānaḥ karoti tryalikhitā bhavanti
analyzed: imān tat lokān karoti atha viśva jyotiṣaḥ karoti etāḥ devatāḥ agnim  vāyum ādityam etāḥ hi eva devatāḥ viśvam jyotiḥ tāḥ etasyāḥ eva mṛdaḥ  karoti ebhyaḥ tat lokebhyaḥ etān devān nirmimīte yajamānaḥ karoti tri a likhitāḥ bhavanti
translated: He makes these worlds. Then he makes the all-light (bricks); the deities Agni, Vâyu, Âditya; for these deities are all the light. Of that same clay🔽he makes them; he fashions these deities for these worlds. The sacrificer makes them; they are marked with three lines.

analyzed: trivṛtaḥ hi ete devāḥ iti adhidevatam
translated: He makes these worlds. He then makes the All-light (bricks). The deities are Agni, Vâyu, Âditya; for these deities are the all-light; he makes them of that same clay;--he thus fashions those deities for those worlds. The sacrificer makes them; they are marked with three lines, for these deities are threefold,--thus much as to the deity.

original: athādhyātmam /🔽ātmaivokhā vāgaṣāḍhā tām pūrvā karoti purastāddhīyamātmano🔽vāktāmetasyā eva mṛdaḥ karotyātmano hyeveyaṃ vāṅnahiṣi karoti mahiṣī hi🔽vāktryālikhitā bhavati tredhāvihitā hi vāgṛco yajūṃṣi sāmānyatho yadidaṃ trayaṃ vāco
analyzed: atha adhyātmam  ātmā eva ukhā vāc aṣāḍhā tām pūrvā karoti purastāt hi iyam ātmanaḥ  vāc tām etasyāḥ eva mṛdaḥ karoti ātmanaḥ hi eva iyam vāc nahiṣi karoti mahiṣī hi  vāc tri ālikhitā bhavati tredhā vihitā hi vāc ṛcaḥ yajūṃṣi sāmāni atha u yat idam trayam vācaḥ
translated: Now as to the body.

analyzed: rūpam upāṃśu vyantarām uccais
translated: The altar is the body, the Aṣāḍha (brick) is speech; he makes that (brick) first, for speech is in front of the body. He makes it of that same clay, for this speech is of the body. He makes it a Mahishî (brick), for speech is a Mahishî. It is marked with three lines, for speech is threefold divided: the Rik, the Yagus, and the Sâman. Moreover, whatever threefold form of speech there is,🔽whether in a whisper, or in an undertone, or aloud,--

original: athokhāṃ karoti /🔽ātmānaṃ tatkarotyatha viśvajyotiṣaḥ karoti prajā vai viśvajyotiḥ
analyzed: atha ukhām karoti  ātmānam tat karoti atha viśvajyotiṣaḥ karoti prajāḥ vai viśvajyotiḥ
translated: he then makes the altar.

original: prajā hyeva viśvaṃ jyotiḥ prajananamevaitatkaroti tā etasyā eva mṛdaḥ
analyzed: prajāḥ hi eva viśvam jyotiḥ prajananam eva etat karoti tāḥ etasyāḥ eva mṛdaḥ
translated: He thereby makes the body. He then makes the All-light (bricks); for the All-light is offspring; for offspring indeed is the all-light. He makes them of that same clay;--he thus produces that offspring for that body.

original: karotyātmanastatprajāṃ nirmimīte yajamānaḥ karoti yajamānastadātmanaḥ prajāṃ🔽karotyanantarhitāḥ karotya nantarhitāṃ tadātmanaḥ prajāṃ karotyuttarāḥ🔽karotyuttarāṃ tadātmanaḥ prajāṃ karoti tryālikhitā bhavanti trivṛddhi prajātiḥ pitā
analyzed: karoti ātmanaḥ tat prajām nirmimīte yajamānaḥ karoti yajamānaḥ tat ātmanaḥ prajām  karoti an antarhitāḥ karoti a nantarhitām tat ātmanaḥ prajām karoti uttarāḥ  karoti uttarām tat ātmanaḥ prajām karoti tri ālikhitāḥ bhavanti trivṛt hi prajātiḥ pitā
translated: The sacrificer makes (them); he creates offspring for himself.🔽He makes (them) without interval; he creates offspring for himself without interval.🔽He makes (them) in succession; he creates offspring for himself in succession.

analyzed: mātā putraḥ thaḥ garbhaḥ ulbam jarāyu
translated: They are marked with three lines; threefold is procreation: father, mother, son, and also embryo, amnion, outer membrane.

original: tā etā yajuṣkṛtāyai karoti /🔽ayajuṣkṛtāyā itarā niruktā eā bhavantyaniruktā itarāḥ
analyzed: tāḥ etāḥ yajuṣkṛtāyai karoti  a yajuṣkṛtāyai itarāḥ niruktāḥ eāḥ bhavanti a niruktāḥ itarāḥ
translated: He makes (them) for the Yajuṣ-made (fire);🔽the other (he makes) for the non-Yajuṣ-made (fire). The former are defined, the other undefined.

analyzed: parimitāḥ etāḥ bhavanti aparimitāḥ itarāḥ
translated: The former are limited, the other unlimited.

analyzed: prajāpatiḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ
translated: This fire is Prajāpati.

original: ubhayamvetatprajāpatirniruktaścāniruktaśca🔽parimitaścāparimitaśca tadyā yajuṣkṛtāyai karoti yadevāsya niruktam parimitaṃ🔽rūpaṃ tadasya tena saṃskarotyatha yā ayajuṣkṛtāyai yadevāsyāniruktamaparimitaṃ
analyzed: ubhayam vai etat prajāpatiḥ niruktaḥ ca a niruktaḥ ca  parimitaḥ ca aparimitaḥ ca tat yāḥ yajuṣkṛtāyai karoti yat eva asya niruktam parimitam  rūpam tat asya tena saṃskaroti atha yāḥ a yajuṣkṛtāyai yat eva asya aniruktam aparimitam
translated: Prajāpati is both of these, defined and undefined,🔽limited and unlimited. In that he makes (them) for the Yajuṣ-made (fire), whatever defined and limited form he has,🔽he perfects that of him by that (act). Then in that he makes (them) for the non-Yajuṣ-made (fire), whatever undefined and unlimited form he has,

original: rūpaṃ tadasya tena saṃskaroti sa ha vā etaṃ sarvaṃ kṛtsnam prajāpatiṃ saṃskaroti ya
analyzed: rūpam tat asya tena saṃskaroti sa ha vai etam sarvam kṛtsnam prajāpatim saṃskaroti yaḥ
translated: he perfects that of him by that (act). He indeed perfects this entire Prajāpati.

original: evaṃ vidvānetadevaṃ karotyathopaśayāyai piṇḍam pariśinaṣṭi prāyaścittibhyaḥ / / /
analyzed: evam vidvān etat evam karoti atha upaśayāyai piṇḍam pariśinaṣṭi prāyaścittibhyaḥ
translated: Knowing this, he acts thus. Then he covers the lump for the Upashayya (oblation) for the atonement of sins.

original: athaināṃ dhūpayati /🔽sthemne nvevātho karmaṇaḥ prakṛtatāyai yadveva dhūpayati śira
analyzed: atha enām dhūpayati  sthemne nu eva atha u karmaṇaḥ prakṛta tāyai yat u eva dhūpayati śiraḥ
translated: Then he fumigates it.🔽For stability, and also for the completion of the rite. In that he fumigates,

original: etadyajñasya yadukhā prāṇo dhūmaḥ śīrṣaṃstatprāṇaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: etat yajñasya yat ukhā prāṇaḥ dhūmaḥ śīrṣan tat prāṇam dadhāti
translated: the fire-pan is the head of the sacrifice, the smoke is the breath, he places the breath in the head.

original: aśvaśakairdhūpayati /🔽prājāpatyo vā aśvaḥ prajāpatiragnirno vā ātmātmānaṃ
analyzed: aśva śakaiḥ dhūpayati  prājāpatyaḥ vai aśvaḥ prajāpatiḥ agniḥ na u vai ātmā ātmānam
translated: He fumigates with horse dung.

original: hinastyahiṃsāyai tadvai śaknaiva taddhi jagghaṃ yātayāma tatho ha naivāśvaṃ hinasti
analyzed: hinasti ahiṃsāyai tat vai śaknā eva tat hi jaggham yātayāma tathā u ha na eva aśvam hinasti
translated: The horse is connected with Prajapati, Agni is Prajapati, one does not injure one's own self, for the sake of non-injury. That is indeed capable, for that is strong and not exhausted. Thus he does not injure the horse,

analyzed: na itarān paśūn  vasavaḥ tvā dhūpayantu  gāyatreṇa candasā aṅgirasvat rudrāḥ tvā dhūpayantu
translated: nor the other animals.🔽May the Vasus fumigate you with the Gayatri meter, O you born of Angiras.🔽May the Rudras fumigate you with the Tristubh meter, O you born of Angiras.

analyzed: traiṣṭubhena candasā aṅgirasvat ādityāḥ tvā dhūpayantu jāgatena candasā aṅgirasvat viśve
translated: May the Adityas fumigate you with the Jagati meter, O you born of Angiras.

original: tvā devā vaiśvānarā dhūpayantvānuṣṭubhena candasāṅgirasvadindrastvā dhūpayatu
analyzed: tvā devāḥ vaiśvānarāḥ dhūpayantu ānuṣṭubhena candasā aṅgirasvat indraḥ tvā dhūpayatu
translated: May the All-gods, the dwellers in the world of men, fumigate you with the Anustubh meter, O you born of Angiras.🔽May Indra fumigate you with the Pankti meter, O you born of Angiras.

analyzed: varuṇaḥ tvā dhūpayatu viṣṇuḥ tvā dhūpayatu iti etābhiḥ eva enām etat devatābhiḥ dhūpayati
translated: 'May Varuna fumigate thee, may Vishnu fumigate thee,'--with these (formulas) he fumigates it with those very deities.

original: saptāśvaśakāni bhavanti /🔽spta yajūṃṣi saptatayya etā devatāḥ sapta śīrṣanprāṇā yadu
analyzed: sapta aśva śakāni bhavanti  spta yajūṃṣi saptatayyaḥ etāḥ devatāḥ sapta śīrṣan prāṇāḥ yat u
translated: There are seven horse-dungs,

original: vā api bahukṛtvaḥ saptasapta saptaiva tacīrṣaṇyeva tatsapta prāṇāndadhāti / / /
analyzed: vai api bahu kṛtvas sapta sapta sapta eva tat cīrṣaṇī eva tat sapta prāṇān dadhāti
translated: and seven Yagus formulas; and those deities are seven, and seven are the vital airs in the head: even if (the horse) is many times (repeated), it is seven times only; and seven vital airs he thus lays into the head.

original: athainamasyāṃ khanati /🔽etadvai devā abibhayuryadvai na imamiha rakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrā
analyzed: atha enam asyām khanati  etat vai devāḥ abibhayuḥ yat vai naḥ imam iha rakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrā
translated: He then digs it out in this (earth).

original: na hanyuriti tasmā imāmevātmānamakurvanguptyā ātmātmānaṃ gopsyatīti / / /
analyzed: na hanyuḥ iti tasmai imām eva ātmānam akurvan guptyai ātmā ātmānam gopsyati iti
translated: For the gods were afraid lest the Rakshas, the fiends, should destroy this (horse) here (on the earth); and they made it their own self for the sake of protection, thinking, 'The self will protect itself.'

analyzed: tam vai adityā khanati
translated: He digs it out with Aditi.

original: iyaṃ vā aditirno vā ātmātmānaṃ hinastyahiṃsāyai yadanyayā🔽devatayā khaneddhiṃsyāddhainam / / /🔽aditiṣṭvā devī viśvadevyāvatī /🔽pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvatkhanatvavaṭetyavaṭo
analyzed: iyam vai aditiḥ na u vai ātmā ātmānam hinasti ahiṃsāyai yat anyayā  devatayā khanet hiṃsyāt ha enam  aditiḥ tvā devī viśvadevyāvatī  pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat khanatu avaṭa iti avaṭaḥ
translated: Aditi, doubtless, is this (earth): he does not injure his own self, for the sake of harmlessness; for were he to dig it out with another deity, he would injure it.

original: haiṣa devatrātra sā vaiṇavyabhrirutsīdati catuḥsraktireṣa kūpo bhavati catasro vai
analyzed: ha eṣa devatrā atra sā vaiṇavī abhriḥ utsīdati catur sraktiḥ eṣa kūpaḥ bhavati catasraḥ vai
translated: 'Aditi, the divine, accompanied by all the gods, dig thee out, like Angiras, in the lap of the earth, O hole!'--for that (hole) is a hole with the gods; and that reed-stalk settles down there; and that hole is four-cornered, for there are four quarters; and the quarters are the Rakshas, the fiends: he thus keeps the Rakshas, the fiends, away from it by the quarters.

analyzed: diśaḥ sarvābhyaḥ eva enam etat digbhyaḥ khanati atha
translated: He digs it out from all the quarters: he thus digs it out for him from all the quarters.

original: racanamavadhāyāṣāḍhāmavadadhāti tūṣṇīmeva tāṃ hi pūrvāṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: racanam avadhāya aṣāḍhām avadadhāti tūṣṇīm eva tām hi pūrvām karoti
translated: Having then laid down the enclosing-stones, he lays down the Âsâdhâ (brick) silently; for that (brick) he makes first.

original: athokhāmavadadhāti /🔽devānāṃ tvā patnīrdevīrviśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe🔽aṅgirasvaddadhatūkha iti devānāṃ haitāmagre patnīrdevīrviśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ🔽sadhasthe 'ṅgirasvaddadhustābhirevaināmetaddadhāti tā ha tā oṣadhaya evauṣadhayo
analyzed: atha ukhām avadadhāti  devānām tvā patnīḥ devīḥ viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe  aṅgirasvat dadhatu ukhe iti devānām ha etām agre patnīḥ devīḥ viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ  sadhasthe ṅgirasvat dadhuḥ tābhiḥ eva enām etat dadhāti tāḥ ha tāḥ oṣadhayaḥ eva oṣadhayaḥ
translated: He then lays down the Ukhâ (hearth).

original: vai devānām patnya oṣadhibhirhīdaṃ sarvaṃ🔽hitamoṣadhibhirevaināmetaddadhātyatha viśvajyotiṣo 'vadadhāti tūṣṇīmevātha
analyzed: vai devānām patnyaḥ oṣadhibhiḥ hi idam sarvam  hitam oṣadhibhiḥ eva enām etat dadhāti atha viśvajyotiṣaḥ vadadhāti tūṣṇīm eva atha
translated: 'May the divine wives of the gods, dear to all the gods, lay thee down in the lap of the earth, O thou rich in ghee, after the manner of Angiras!' For formerly the divine wives of the gods, dear to all the gods, laid it down in the lap of the earth after the manner of Angiras; with them he thus lays it down. But they are those plants; for the wives of the gods are the plants.🔽With the plants he thus lays it down. He then lays down the Visvagyotis bricks silently;

analyzed: pacanam avadhāya abhīnddhe
translated: he then lays down the cooking-pot and kindles it.

analyzed: dhiṣaṇāḥ tvā devīḥ  viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat abhīndhatāmukha
translated: 'The divine Dhisha (quarters),

original: iti dhiṣaṇā haitāmagre devīrviśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe 'ṅgirasvadabhīdhire
analyzed: iti dhiṣaṇāḥ ha etām agre devīḥ viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe ṅgirasvat abhīdhire
translated: dear to all the gods, may they, O thou rich in ghee, kindle thee in the lap of the earth, after the manner of Angiras!' For formerly the divine Dhisha (quarters), dear to all the gods, kindled it in the lap of the earth, after the manner of Angiras;

original: tābhirevaināmetadabhīnddhe sā ha sā vāgeva vāgvai dhiṣaṇā vācā hīdaṃ
analyzed: tābhiḥ eva enām etat abhīnddhe sā ha sā vāc eva vāc vai dhiṣaṇā vācā hi idam
translated: verily with them he kindles it. It is speech, the mind; the mind is the same as speech, for by speech this (universe) is supported.

original: sarvamiddhaṃ vācaivaināmetadabhīnddhe 'thaitāni trīṇi yajūṃṣīkṣamāṇa eva japati / / /
analyzed: sarvam iddham vācā eva enām etat abhīnddhe tha etāni trīṇi yajūṃṣi īkṣamāṇaḥ eva japati
translated: By them he now kindles it. It is indeed speech, for the Dhishana is speech, since by speech all this (universe) is kindled; by speech he now kindles it. Then he murmurs those three Yagus formulas while he is looking on.

analyzed: varūtrī iṣṭvā devīḥ
translated: 'The Varutras, the goddesses,

original: viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhastha aṅgirasvacrapayantūkha iti🔽varūtrīrhaitāmagre devīrviśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe 'ṅgirasvacrapayāṃ
analyzed: viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhastha aṅgirasvacrapayantu ukhe iti  varūtrīḥ ha etām agre devīḥ viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe ṅgirasvacrapayām
translated: accompanied by all the gods, do ye, O ye of Angiras' nature, bake it on the earth's surface.'

original: cakrustābhirevaināmetacrapayati tāni ha tānyahorātrāṇyevāhorātrāṇi vai varūtrayo
analyzed: cakruḥ tābhiḥ eva enām etat crapayati tāni ha tāni ahar rātrāṇi eva ahar rātrāṇi vai varūtrayaḥ
translated: For the Varutras, the goddesses, accompanied by all the gods, did in the beginning bake it on the earth's surface, O ye of Angiras' nature; by them he now bakes it. But they are indeed the days and nights; for the Varutras are the days and nights;

analyzed: horātraiḥ hi idam sarvam vṛtam ahorātraiḥ eva enām etat crapayati
translated: for by the days and nights everything here is enclosed; by the days and nights he now bakes it.

analyzed: gnāḥ tvā devīḥ
translated: 'The Gnas, the goddesses,

original: viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvatpacantūkha iti gnā🔽haitāmagre devīrviśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe
analyzed: viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat pacantu ukhe iti gnā  ha etām agre devīḥ viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe
translated: accompanied by all the gods, do ye, O ye of Angiras' nature, bake it on the earth's surface.'

original: 'ṅgirasvatpecustābhiravaināmetatpacati tāni ha tāni candāṃsyeva candāṃsi vai
analyzed: ṅgirasvat pecuḥ tābhiḥ ava enām etat pacati tāni ha tāni candāṃsi eva candāṃsi vai
translated: For the Gnas, the goddesses, accompanied by all the gods, did in the beginning bake it on the earth's surface, O ye of Angiras' nature; by them he now bakes it. But they are indeed the metres; for the Gnas are the metres;

original: gnāścandobhirhi svargaṃ lokaṃ gacanti candobhirevaināmetatpacati / / /🔽janayastvācinnapatrā devīḥ /
analyzed: gnāḥ candobhiḥ hi svargam lokam gacanti candobhiḥ eva enām etat pacati  janayaḥ tvā a cinna patrāḥ devīḥ
translated: The Gnas go to heaven by the metres; by the metres he cooks it.🔽The Janyas, the goddesses with the unclipped wings,

original: viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe🔽aṅgirasvatpacantūkha iti janayo haitāmagre 'cinnapatrā devīrviśvadevyāvatīḥ
analyzed: viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe  aṅgirasvat pacantu ukhe iti janayaḥ ha etām agre cinna patrāḥ devīḥ viśvadevyāvatīḥ
translated: attended by all the gods,🔽let them cook thee in the lap of the earth like Angiras. The Janyas indeed first cooked it, the goddesses with the unclipped wings,

original: pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvatpecustābhirevaināmetatpacati tāni ha tāni
analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat pecuḥ tābhiḥ eva enām etat pacati tāni ha tāni
translated: attended by all the gods, in the lap of the earth like Angiras. With them he cooks it. Those are

original: nakṣatrāṇyeva nakṣatrāṇi vai janayo ye hi janāḥ puṇyakṛtaḥ svargaṃ lokaṃ yanti
analyzed: nakṣatrāṇi eva nakṣatrāṇi vai janayaḥ ye hi janāḥ puṇya kṛtaḥ svargam lokam yanti
translated: indeed the stars. The Janyas are indeed the stars, for those people who have done good deeds and go to heaven,

analyzed: teṣām etāni jyotīṃṣi nakṣatraiḥ eva enām etat pacati
translated: those are their lights. With the stars he cooks it.

original: sa vai khanatyekena /🔽avadadhātyekenābhīnddha ekena śrapayatyekena dvābhyām
analyzed: sa vai khanati ekena  avadadhāti ekena abhīnddhe ekena śrapayati ekena dvābhyām
translated: He digs with one (formula),

original: pacati tasmāddviḥ saṃvatsarasyānnam pacyate tāni ṣaṭ sampadyante ṣadṛtavaḥ
analyzed: pacati tasmāt dvis saṃvatsarasya annam pacyate tāni ṣaḍ sampadyante ṣaṣ ṛtavaḥ
translated: he puts (the fire) down with one, he kindles it with one, he heats it with one, with two he cooks it; therefore twice in the year food is cooked. They make up six, six are the seasons,

analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvat tat bhavati
translated: the year; the year is Agni: as great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, so great does this become.

analyzed: atha mitrasya carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ iti
translated: Then (he recites the verse), 'Of Mitra, the supporter of men' .

analyzed: maitreṇa yajuṣā upanyācarati yāvat kiyat ca upanyācarati
translated: With a friendly Yagus he approaches it, whatever (Yagus) he approaches it with.

original: na vai mitraṃ kaṃ cana hinasti na mitraṃ kaścana hinasti tatho haiṣa etāṃ na hinasti
analyzed: na vai mitram kam cana hinasti na mitram kaścana hinasti tathā u ha eṣa etām na hinasti
translated: A friend does not injure any one, nor does any one injure a friend; in the same way this (fire) does not injure it,

analyzed: na u etam eṣā tām divā eva upavapet divā udvapet ahar hi āgneyam
translated: nor does it injure this (fire). On the same day on which he digs it, on that day he should put it down; from the sky he should take it, from the sky he should put it down. The (fire) belonging to Agni (is to be taken) by day.

analyzed: tām sāvitreṇa yajuṣu udapati
translated: He puts it down with a Savitri Yagus.

analyzed: savitā vai prasavitā savitṛ prasūtaḥ eva enām etat udvapati
translated: Savitri is the impeller; impelled by Savitri he thus puts it down.

original: devastvā savitodvapatu supāṇiḥ svaṅguriḥ subāhuruta śaktyeti sarvamu hyetatsavitā / / /
analyzed: devaḥ tvā savitā udvapatu su pāṇiḥ su aṅguriḥ su bāhuḥ uta śaktyā iti sarvam u hi etat savitā
translated: 'May the god Savitri, the good hand, the good arm, the good dexterous one, put thee down', (with these words) he puts it down; for all this is Savitri.

original: athainām paryāvartayati /🔽avyathamānā pṛthivyāmāśā diśa āpṛṇetyavyathamānā tvam
analyzed: atha enām paryāvartayati  a vyathamānā pṛthivyām āśāḥ diśaḥ āpṛṇa iti a vyathamānā tvam
translated: He then turns it round.

analyzed: pṛthivyām āśāḥ diśaḥ rasena āpūraya iti etat
translated: 'Uninjured, fill thou the regions and the quarters on the earth', (with these words) he turns it round; 'uninjured thou', (he says), 'fill thou the regions and the quarters with sap', he thereby says.

original: athaināmudyacati /🔽utthāya bṛhatī bhavetyutthāya hīme lokā bṛhanta udu tiṣṭha
analyzed: atha enām udyacati  utthāya bṛhatī bhava iti utthāya hi ime lokāḥ bṛhantaḥ udu tiṣṭha
translated: He then lifts it up.

original: dhruvā tvamityudu tiṣṭha sthirā tvam pratiṣṭhitetyetat / / /
analyzed: dhruvā tvam iti udu tiṣṭha sthirā tvam pratiṣṭhitā iti etat
translated: 'Rising, be thou great', (with these words) he lifts it up; for rising these worlds are great. 'Thou art firm', (with these words) he lifts it up; 'thou art firm', he thereby says, 'thou art established'.

analyzed: tām parigṛhya nidadhāti
translated: Having taken it round, he puts it down.

original: mitraitāṃ ta ukhā paridadāmyabhittyā eṣā mā bhedityayaṃ
analyzed: mitra etām te ukhā paridadāmi a bhittyai eṣā mā bhet iti ayam
translated: 'O Mitra, I give thee this pan, that it may not be broken', (with these words) he puts it down; 'this (fire) of thine', he thereby says.

original: vai vāyurmitro yo 'yam pavate tasmā evaināmetatparidadāti guptyai te heme lokā
analyzed: vai vāyuḥ mitraḥ yaḥ yam pavate tasmai eva enām etat paridadāti guptyai te ha ime lokā
translated: Vâyu is Mitra, he who blows here: to him he commits it for protection. These worlds

original: mitraguptāstasmādeṣāṃ lokānāṃ na kiṃ cana mīyate / / /
analyzed: mitra guptāḥ tasmāt eṣām lokānām na kim cana mīyate
translated: are protected by Mitra: therefore nothing is lost of these worlds.

original: athaināmācṛṇatti /🔽sthemne nvevātho karmaṇaḥ prakṛtatāyai yadvevācūṇatti śira
analyzed: atha enām ācṛṇatti  sthemne nu eva atha u karmaṇaḥ prakṛta tāyai yat u eva ācūṇatti śiraḥ
translated: He then covers it (with the lump of clay).

original: etadyajñasya yadukhā prāṇaḥ payaḥ śīrpastatprāṇaṃ dadhātyatho yoṣā vā ukhā🔽yoṣāyāṃ tatpayo dadhāti tasmādyoṣāyām payaḥ / / /
analyzed: etat yajñasya yat ukhā prāṇaḥ payaḥ śīrpaḥ tat prāṇam dadhāti atha u yoṣā vai ukhā  yoṣāyām tat payaḥ dadhāti tasmāt yoṣāyām payaḥ
translated: For firmness, and also for the completion of the rite. And, again, why he covers it;--the pan is the head of this sacrifice, and milk is breath: he thus puts breath into the head. Moreover, the pan is a female,🔽and into the female he puts the milk: hence milk is in the female.

analyzed: ajāyai payasā ācṛṇatti  prajāpateḥ vai śokāt ajā samabhavan prajāpatiḥ agniḥ na u vā
translated: He covers it with the milk of a she-goat.

original: ātmātmānaṃ hinastyahiṃsāyai yadvevājāyā ajā ha sarvā oṣadhīratti
analyzed: ātmā ātmānam hinasti ahiṃsāyai yat u eva ajāyāḥ ajā ha sarvāḥ oṣadhīḥ atti
translated: From the grief of Pragâpati the she-goat sprang: Pragâpati is Agni, and one does not injure one's own self; (he does so) for the sake of harmlessness. And, again, why (he does so) with a she-goat;--the she-goat eats all herbs:

analyzed: sarvāsām eva enām etat oṣadhīnām rasena ācṛṇatti  vasavaḥ tvā ācūndantu  gāyatreṇa candasā aṅgirasvat rudrāḥ tvā ācṛndantu traiṣṭubhena
translated: with the sap of all herbs he thus covers it.🔽'May the Vasus cover thee with the Gâyatra metre, O thou of the Angiras' race!'🔽'May the Rudras cover thee with the Trishtubh metre, O thou of the Angiras' race!'

analyzed: candasā aṅgirasvat ādityāḥ tvā ācṛndantu jāgatena candasā aṅgirasvat viśve tvā devā
translated: 'May the Âdityas cover thee with the Gagatî metre, O thou of the Angiras' race!'🔽'May the Visve Devâh cover thee with the Anushtubh metre, O thou of the Angiras' race!'

analyzed: vaiśvānarāḥ ācṛndantu ānuṣṭubhena
translated: May the Vaiśvānara fires draw you with the Anushtubh meter.

analyzed: candasā aṅgirasvat iti etābhiḥ eva enām etat devatābhiḥ ācṛṇatti sa vai yābhiḥ eva devatābhiḥ
translated: Let the Vaiśvānara (cakes) be offered with the Anushtubh metre, O son of Aṅgiras. With these very deities he offers it. With those very deities

original: karoti tābhirdhūpayati tābhirācṛṇatti yo vāva karma karoti sa evaṃ tasyopacāraṃ veda
analyzed: karoti tābhiḥ dhūpayati tābhiḥ ācṛṇatti yaḥ vāva karma karoti saḥ evam tasya upacāram veda
translated: with which he performs, with them he fumigates, with them he offers. For he who performs a rite knows the procedure of it in this way.

analyzed: tasmāt yābhiḥ eva devatābhiḥ karoti tābhiḥ dhūpayati tābhiḥ ācṛṇatti
translated: Therefore, with those very deities with which he performs, with them he fumigates, with them he offers.

analyzed: bhūyāṃsi havīṃṣi bhavanti
translated: There are many oblations.

original: agnicityāyāṃ yadu cānagnicityāyāmatīni ha karmāṇi santi🔽yānyanyatkarmāti tānyatīni teṣāmagnicityā rājasūyo vājapeyī
analyzed: agni cityāyām yat u ca an agni cityāyām atīni ha karmāṇi santi  yāni anyat karma ati tāni atīni teṣām agni cityāḥ rājasūyaḥ vājapeyī
translated: In the agnicayana and in what is not the agnicayana, there are three rites that are in excess.

analyzed: śvamedhaḥ tat yat tāni anyāni karmāṇi ati tasmāt tāni atīni
translated: Those that are in excess of other rites are the three, namely the agnicayana, the Rajasuya, the Vajapeya, and the Ashvamedha. Because they are in excess of other rites, therefore they are in excess.

analyzed: āgnāvaiṣṇavaḥ ekādaśa kapālaḥ
translated: An eleven-kapala cake to Agni-Vishnu.

analyzed: tat adhvarasya dīkṣaṇīyam vaiśvānaraḥ dvādaśa kapāla
translated: That is the consecration rite of the Adhvara. A twelve-kapala cake to Vaisvānara Agni,

analyzed: ādityaḥ ca caruḥ te agneḥ
translated: and an oblation to Āditya. Those are of Agni.

analyzed: sa yat āgnāvaiṣṇavam eva nirvapet
translated: If he were to offer only the one to Agni-Vishnu,

analyzed: na itare haviṣī adhvarasya eva dīkṣaṇīyam kṛtam
translated: the other two oblations would not be the consecration rite of the Adhvara.

original: syānnāgneratha yaditare eva haviṣī nirvapennāgnāvaiṣṇavamagnereva dīkṣaṇīyaṃ
analyzed: syāt na agneḥ atha yat itare eva haviṣī nirvapet na āgnāvaiṣṇavam agneḥ eva dīkṣaṇīyam
translated: If he were to offer the other oblations and not the one to Agni and Visnu, the consecration would be performed for Agni only,

analyzed: kṛtam syāt na adhvarasya
translated: and not for the sacrifice.

analyzed: ubhayāni nirvapati  adhvarasya ca agneḥ ca ubhayam hi etat karma adhvara karma
translated: He offers both (oblations).🔽For the sacrifice and for Agni, for this rite is both a rite for the sacrifice and a rite for Agni.

analyzed: ca agnikarma ca adhvarasya pūrvam atha agneḥ upāyi hi etat karma yat agnikarma
translated: The rite for Agni is subordinate to the rite for the sacrifice.

analyzed: sa yaḥ eṣaḥ āgnāvaiṣṇavaḥ
translated: Now, that (oblation) to Agni and Visnu,

analyzed: tasya tat eva brāhmaṇam yat puraścaraṇe vaiśvānaraḥ
translated: its Brâhmana is the same as that of the one at the preliminary initiation.

analyzed: dvādaśa kapālaḥ vaiśvānaraḥ vai sarve gnayaḥ sarveṣām agnīnām upāptyai
translated: To Vaiśvânara (he offers) on twelve potsherds; for all the fires are Vaiśvânara: (he offers thus) for the obtainment of all the fires.

original: dvādaśakapālo dvādaśa māsāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaro vaiśvānaraḥ / / /
analyzed: dvādaśa kapālaḥ dvādaśa māsāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ vaiśvānaraḥ
translated: On twelve potsherds (he offers);--twelve months are a year, and the year is Vaiśvânara.

analyzed: yat u eva etam vaiśvānaram nirvapati
translated: And, again, as to why he offers that to Vaiśvânara.

analyzed: vaiśvānaram vai etam agnim janayiṣyan bhavati
translated: He now becomes that Agni Vaiśvânara whom he is about to generate;

original: tametatpurastāddīkṣaṇīyāyāṃ reto bhūtaṃ siñcati yādṛgvai yonau retaḥ sicyate
analyzed: tam etat purastāt dīkṣaṇīyāyām retaḥ bhūtam siñcati yādṛś vai yonau retaḥ sicyate
translated: and that (Agni) he now pours out as seed in front of the consecration, for whatever seed is poured out into the womb

original: tādṛgjāyate tadyadetamatra vaiśvānaraṃ reto bhūtaṃ siñcati tasmādeṣo 'mutra
analyzed: tādṛś jāyate tat yat etam atra vaiśvānaram retaḥ bhūtam siñcati tasmāt eṣaḥ mutra
translated: that is born like that. And because he now pours out that Agni Vaiśvânara as seed, therefore he (Agni) is born here

analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ jāyate
translated: Vaiśvānara is born.

original: yadvevaite haviṣī nirvapati /🔽kṣatraṃ vai vaiśvānaro viḍeṣa ādityaścaruḥ kṣatraṃ ca
analyzed: yat u eva ete haviṣī nirvapati  kṣatram vai vaiśvānaraḥ viś eṣaḥ ādityaḥ caruḥ kṣatram ca
translated: And again, why he offers these two oblations.🔽Vaiśvānara is the Kshatriya, this rice-pap for the sun is the people; he makes the Kshatriya and the people.

original: tadviśaṃ ca karoti vaiśvānaram pūrvaṃ nirvapati kṣatraṃ tatkṛtvā viśe karoti / / /🔽eka eṣa bhavati /🔽ekadevatya ekasthaṃ tatkṣatramekasthāṃ śriyaṃ karoti caruritaro🔽bahudevatyo bhūmā vā eṣa taṇḍulānāṃ yaccarurbhūmo eṣa devānāṃ yadādityā viśi
analyzed: tat viśam ca karoti vaiśvānaram pūrvam nirvapati kṣatram tat kṛtvā viśe karoti  ekaḥ eṣa bhavati  eka devatyaḥ ekastham tat kṣatram ekasthām śriyam karoti caruḥ itaraḥ  bahu devatyaḥ bhūmā vai eṣa taṇḍulānām yat caruḥ bhūmā u eṣa devānām yat ādityāḥ viśi
translated: He offers the Vaiśvānara first; having made the Kshatriya, he makes the people.🔽This (oblation) is one (to one deity); he makes the Kshatriya one, of one place, of one glory. The other is a rice-pap, to many deities.

analyzed: tat bhūmānam dadhāti iti adhidevatam
translated: This rice-pap is the most abundant of the grains; the sun is the most abundant of the gods; he places abundance in the people. Thus much as to the deity.

analyzed: atha adhyātmam
translated: Now as to the body.

original: śira eva vaiśvānara ātmaiṣa ādityaścaruḥ śiraśca tadātmānaṃ ca
analyzed: śiraḥ eva vaiśvānaraḥ ātmā eṣaḥ ādityaḥ caruḥ śiraḥ ca tat ātmānam ca
translated: The head is Vaiśvānara, the body is this rice-pap for the sun; he makes the head and the body.

original: karoti vaiśvānaram pūrvaṃ nirvapati śirastatkṛtvātmānaṃ karoti / / /🔽eka eṣa bhavati /
analyzed: karoti vaiśvānaram pūrvam nirvapati śiraḥ tat kṛtvā ātmānam karoti  ekaḥ eṣa bhavati
translated: He offers the Vaiśvānara first; having made the head, he makes the body.

original: ekamiva hi śiraścaruritaro bahudevatyo bhūmā vā eṣa taṇḍulānāṃ
analyzed: ekam iva hi śiraḥ caruḥ itaraḥ bahu devatyaḥ bhūmā vai eṣa taṇḍulānām
translated: This (oblation) is one (to one deity); the head is as it were one. The other is a rice-pap, to many deities.

analyzed: yat caruḥ bhūmā u eṣaḥ ṅgānām yat ātmā ātman tat aṅgānām bhūmānam dadhāti
translated: This rice-pap is the most abundant of the grains; the body is the most abundant of the limbs; he places abundance in the limbs.

analyzed: ghṛtaḥ eṣa bhavati
translated: This (oblation) is with ghee;

analyzed: ghṛta bhājanāḥ hi ādityāḥ svena eva enān etat bhāgena svena rasena
translated: The Âdityas are the possessors of ghee: with their own share, with their own juice, he thus makes them enter into him.

original: prīṇātyupāṃśvetāni havīṃṣi bhavanti reto vā atra yajña upāṃśu vai retaḥ sicyate / / /
analyzed: prīṇāti upāṃśu etāni havīṃṣi bhavanti retaḥ vai atra yajñaḥ upāṃśu vai retaḥ sicyate
translated: for the Âdityas are the vessels of ghee: with their own share, with their own sap, he thus gratifies them. The oblations are low-voiced; for the sacrifice here is seed, and seed is indeed low-voiced (i.e. secretly) infused.

original: athaudgrabhaṇāni juhoti /🔽audgrabhaṇairvai devā ātmānamasmāllokātsvargaṃ🔽lokamabhyudagṛhṇata yadudagṛhṇata tasmādaudgrabhaṇāni tathaivaitadyajamāna
analyzed: atha audgrabhaṇāni juhoti  audgrabhaṇaiḥ vai devāḥ ātmānam asmāt lokāt svargam  lokam abhyudagṛhṇata yat udagṛhṇata tasmāt audgrabhaṇāni tathā eva etat yajamāna
translated: He then offers the Audgrabhana libations.

analyzed: audgrabhaṇaiḥ eva ātmānam asmāt lokāt svargam lokam abhyudgṛhṇīte
translated: By means of the Audgrabhanas the gods lifted themselves from this world to the heavenly world; and because they lifted themselves (ud-grabh), therefore (they are called) Audgrabhanas. In like manner does the Sacrificer, by means of the Audgrabhanas, now lift himself from this world to the heavenly world.

analyzed: tāni vai bhūyāṃsi bhavanti
translated: They are more numerous (than the others).

analyzed: agnicityāyām yat u ca an agnicityāyām tasya aktaḥ
translated: At the agnicayana (altar-building) and also at (other sacrifices) not involving an agnicayana (altar-building). The reason of this has been told.

analyzed: bandhuḥ ubhayāni bhavanti tasya uktaḥ dhvarasya pūrvāṇi atha agneḥ tasya u eva uktaḥ
translated: They are of both kinds, and the reason of this has been told. Those (libations) of the Soma-sacrifice precede those of the Agni (altar-building). The reason of this has been told.

original: pañcādvarasya juhoti /🔽pāṅkto yajño yāvānyajño yāvatyasya mātrā
analyzed: pañcāt varasya juhoti  pāṅktaḥ yajñaḥ yāvān yajñaḥ yāvatī asya mātrā
translated: He offers five (libations) to the Soma-sacrifice,

original: tāvataivainametadreto bhūtaṃ siñcati saptāgneḥ saptacitiko 'gniḥ sapta 'rtavaḥ
analyzed: tāvatā eva enam etat retaḥ bhūtam siñcati sapta agneḥ sapta citikaḥ gniḥ sapta ṛtavaḥ
translated: for the sacrifice is fivefold: as great as the sacrifice is, as great as is its measure, by so much he thus pours that seed into it. Seven (libations) to the (Agni) fire-altar; for the fire-altar consists of seven layers, and there are seven seasons.

original: saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaro 'gniryāvānagniryāvatyasya mātrā tāvataivainametadreto bhūtaṃ🔽siñcati tānyubhayāni dvādaśa sampadyante dvādaśa māsāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaro
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvatā eva enam etat retaḥ bhūtam  siñcati tāni ubhayāni dvādaśa sampadyante dvādaśa māsāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: The year is the year, Agni; as great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, with so much he thus pours him as seed.

original: 'gniryāvānagniryāvatyasya mātrā tāvattadbhavati / / /🔽sa juhoti / ākūtimagniṃ prayujaṃ svāhetyākūtādvā etadagre karma
analyzed: gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvat tat bhavati  sa juhoti ākūtim agnim prayujam svāhā iti ākūtāt vai etat agre karma
translated: Those two sets make twelve; the year consists of twelve months; the year is Agni; as great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, so great does this become.

analyzed: samabhavat tat eva etat etasmai karmaṇe prayuṅkte
translated: He offers, 'The intention, the instigator, Agni, hail!' From the intention this rite originated at first; verily he instigates it for this rite.

original: mano meghāmagnim prayujaṃ svāheti /🔽manaso vā etadagre karma
analyzed: manaḥ meghām agnim prayujam svāhā iti  manasaḥ vai etat agre karma
translated: 'The mind, the cloud, the instigator, Agni, hail!'

analyzed: samabhavat tat eva etat etasmai karmaṇe prayuṅkte
translated: From the mind this rite originated at first; verily he instigates it for this rite.

original: cittaṃ vijñātamagnim prayujaṃ svāheti /🔽cittādvā etadagre karma
analyzed: cittam vijñātam agnim prayujam svāhā iti  cittāt vai etat agre karma
translated: 'The thought, the knowledge, the instigator, Agni, hail!'

analyzed: samabhavat tat eva etat etasmai karmaṇe prayuṅkte
translated: From the thought this rite originated at first; verily he instigates it for this rite.

original: vāco vidhṛtimagnim prayujaṃ svāheti /🔽vāco vā etadagre karma
analyzed: vācaḥ vidhṛtim agnim prayujam svāhā iti  vācaḥ vai etat agre karma
translated: 'The support of speech, the instigator, Agni, hail!'

analyzed: samabhavat tām eva etat etasmai karmaṇe prayuṅkte
translated: From speech this rite originated at first; verily he instigates it for this rite.

analyzed: prajāpataye manave svāhā iti
translated: 'To Prajapati, to Manu, hail!'

analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai manuḥ sa hi idam sarvam amanuta
translated: Manu is Prajapati, for he measured (ma) this all (nu).

original: prajāpatirvā etadagre karmākarottamevaitadetasmai karmaṇe prayuṅkte / / /🔽agnaye vaiśvānarāya svāheti /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai etat agre karma akarot tam eva etat etasmai karmaṇe prayuṅkte  agnaye vaiśvānarāya svāhā iti
translated: Prajapati performed this rite first; he employs it for this rite.🔽To Agni Vaisvânara svâhâ!

original: saṃvatsaro vā agnirvaiśvānaraḥ saṃvatsaro vā etadagre
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ vai agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ vai etat agre
translated: Agni Vaisvânara is the year; the year performed this rite first; he employs it for this rite.🔽 To Agni Svishtakrit svâhâ!

analyzed: karma akarottam eva etat etasmai karmaṇe prayuṅkte
translated: Agni Svishtakrit is the sacrifice; the sacrifice performed this rite first; he employs it for this rite.

analyzed: atha sāvitrīm juhoti
translated: He then offers the Sâvitrî verse,

original: savitā vā etadagre karmākarottamevaitadetasmai karmaṇe🔽prayuṅkte viśvo devasya neturmarto vurīta sakhyam viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṃ
analyzed: savitā vai etat agre karma akarot tam eva etat etasmai karmaṇe  prayuṅkte viśvaḥ devasya netuḥ martaḥ vurīta sakhyam viśvaḥ rāyaḥ iṣudhyati dyumnam
translated: Savitri performed this rite first; he employs it for this rite.🔽May every mortal win the friendship of the divine leader; may every one strive for wealth and prosperity,🔽and choose glory,

original: vṛṇīta puṣyase svāheti yo devasya savituḥ sakhyaṃ vṛṇīte sa dyumnaṃ ca puṣṭiṃ ca
analyzed: vṛṇīta puṣyase svāhā iti yaḥ devasya savituḥ sakhyam vṛṇīte sa dyumnam ca puṣṭim ca
translated: that he may prosper, svâhâ! He who chooses the friendship of the divine Savitri, he chooses glory and prosperity,

original: vṛṇīta eṣa asya sakhyaṃ vṛṇīte ya etatkarma karoti / / /
analyzed: vṛṇīte eṣaḥ asya sakhyam vṛṇīte yaḥ etat karma karoti
translated: and chooses his friendship who performs this rite.

original: tānyu haike /🔽ukhāyāmevaitānyaudgrabhaṇāni juhvati kāmebhyo vā etāni hūyanta
analyzed: tāni u ha eke  ukhāyām eva etāni audgrabhaṇāni juhvati kāmebhyaḥ vai etāni hūyanta
translated: Some,🔽on the very fire-pan, offer these Aughrahanas, thinking, We will establish on the self of the Sacrificer all the wishes (of the Sacrificer).

original: ātmo eṣa yajamānasya yadukhātmanyajamānasya sarvānkāmānpratiṣṭhāpayāma iti
analyzed: ātmā u eṣa yajamānasya yat ukhā ātman yajamānasya sarvān kāmān pratiṣṭhāpayāmaḥ iti
translated: The fire-pan is the self of the Sacrificer; we will establish on the self of the Sacrificer all the wishes (of the Sacrificer).

original: na tathā kuryādetasya vai yajñasya saṃsthitasyaitāsāmāhutīnāṃ yo🔽rasastadetadarciryaddīpyate tadyatsaṃsthite yajñe huteṣvaudgrabhaṇeṣūkhām🔽pravṛṇakti tadenāmeṣa yajña ārohati taṃ yajñam bibharti tasmātsaṃsthita eva yajñe
analyzed: na tathā kuryāt etasya vai yajñasya saṃsthitasya etāsām āhutīnām yaḥ  rasaḥ tat etat arciḥ yat dīpyate tat yat saṃsthite yajñe huteṣu audgrabhaṇeṣu ukhām  pravṛṇakti tat enām eṣa yajñaḥ ārohati tam yajñam bibharti tasmāt saṃsthitaḥ eva yajñe
translated: He should not do so, for the essence of those oblations of the completed sacrifice

analyzed: huteṣu audgrabhaṇeṣu ukhām pravṛñjyāt
translated: is that flame which burns. When the sacrifice is completed, when the Audgrabhana libations have been offered, he puts the Ukhya fire on the Gârhapatya; he thus mounts that sacrifice, he supports that sacrifice: therefore let him put the Ukhya fire on the Gârhapatya when the sacrifice is completed, when the Audgrabhana libations have been offered.

original: muñjakulāyenāvastīrṇā bhavati /🔽ādīpyāditi nveva yadveva muñjakulāyena🔽yonireṣāgneryanmuñjo na vai yonirgarbhaṃ hinastyahiṃsāyai yonirvai jāyamāno
analyzed: muñja kulāyena avastīrṇā bhavati  ādīpyāt iti nu eva yat u eva muñja kulāyena  yoniḥ eṣā agneḥ yat muñjaḥ na vai yoniḥ garbham hinasti ahiṃsāyai yoniḥ vai jāyamānaḥ
translated: It is covered with a mat of Muñja grass.

analyzed: jāyate yoneḥ jāyamānaḥ jāyātai iti
translated: 'Let him light it,'--this, indeed, is the reason why (it is covered with a mat of Muñja grass); for that Muñja grass is the womb of that (sacred) fire; and the womb does not injure the embryo: (it serves) for the safety (of the fire). From the womb, indeed, he who is born is born; and he who is born from the womb is born for a long life: (it serves) for his being born for a long life.

original: śaṇakulāyamantaram bhavati /🔽ādipyāditi nveva yadveva śaṇakulāyam prajāpatiryasyai
analyzed: śaṇa kulāyam antaram bhavati  ādipyāt iti nu eva yat u eva śaṇa kulāyam prajāpatiḥ yasyai
translated: In the middle (of the fire-pan) there is a mat of hempen cloth.

original: yonerasṛjyata tasyā umā ulbamāsañcaṇā jarāyu tasmātte pūtayo jarāyu hi te na vai🔽jarāyu garbhaṃ hinastyahiṃsāyai jarāyuṇo vai jāyamāno jāyate jarāyuṇo jāyamāno
analyzed: yoneḥ asṛjyata tasyāḥ umāḥ ulbam āsan caṇāḥ jarāyu tasmāt te pūtayaḥ jarāyu hi te na vai  jarāyu garbham hinasti ahiṃsāyai jarāyuṇaḥ vai jāyamānaḥ jāyate jarāyuṇaḥ jāyamānaḥ
translated: 'Let him light it,'--this, indeed, is the reason why (it is covered with a mat of hempen cloth); for that hempen cloth is the womb from which Pragâpati was created; the Umâ was its outer skin, and the hempen cloth its inner skin: hence they are purifying (cloths), for they are the inner skin.

analyzed: jāyātai iti
translated: The inner skin does not injure the embryo: (it serves) for the safety (of the fire). From the inner skin, indeed, he who is born is born; and he who is born from the inner skin is born for a long life: (it serves) for his being born for a long life.

original: tāṃ tiṣṭhanpravṛṇakti ime vai lokā ukhā tiṣṭhantīva vā ime lokā atho tiṣṭhanvai🔽vīryavattamaḥ / / /🔽udaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhan /
analyzed: tām tiṣṭhan pravṛṇakti ime vai lokāḥ ukhā tiṣṭhanti iva vai ime lokāḥ atha u tiṣṭhan vai  vīryavattamaḥ  udaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhan
translated: Standing, he puts it on (the altar); for this (terrestrial) world is the pan; and these worlds, as it were, stand. But, besides, he who stands is stronger.🔽Standing, with his face to the north-east,

analyzed: udaṅ vai prāṅ tiṣṭhan prajāpatiḥ prajāḥ asṛjat
translated: for Pragâpati, standing with his face to the north-east, created living beings.

analyzed: yat u eva udaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhan
translated: And, again, as to why standing, with his face to the north-east;

analyzed: eṣā ha ubhayeṣām deva manuṣyāṇām diś yat udīcī prācī
translated: for that (quarter), the north-east, is the quarter of both gods and men.

original: yadvevodaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhan /🔽etasyāṃ ha diśi svargasya lokasya dvāraṃ tasmādudaṅ prāṅ
analyzed: yat u eva udaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhan  etasyām ha diśi svargasya lokasya dvāram tasmāt udaṅ prāṅ
translated: And, again, as to why standing, with his face to the north-east;

original: tiṣṭhannāhutīrjuhotyudaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhandakṣiṇā nayati dvāraiva tatsvargasya lokasya
analyzed: tiṣṭhan āhutīḥ juhoti udaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhan dakṣiṇāḥ nayati dvārā eva tat svargasya lokasya
translated: for in that quarter is the gate of the world of heaven: hence, standing with his face to the north-east, he offers his oblations; standing with his face to the north-east he leads up the Dakshinâs; by the gate he thus leads them to the world of heaven.

translated: That Agni is yonder sun; the two Indras are these two worlds;

original: amum tadādityamābhyāṃ lokābhyām parigṛhṇāti tasmādeṣa ābhyāṃ lokābhyām
analyzed: amum tat ādityam ābhyām lokābhyām parigṛhṇāti tasmāt eṣaḥ ābhyām lokābhyām
translated: he thus encloses yonder sun on both sides by these two worlds: hence he is enclosed on both sides by these two worlds.

original: parigṛhītaḥ parimaṇḍale bhavataḥ parimaṇḍalau hīmau lokau mauñje trivṛtī
analyzed: parigṛhītaḥ parimaṇḍale bhavataḥ parimaṇḍalau hi imau lokau mauñje trivṛtī
translated: It is surrounded, for these two worlds are surrounded. The two Mauñja cords are threefold.

original: tasyokto bandhurmṛdā digdhe tasyo evokto 'tho anatidāhāya / / /
analyzed: tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ mṛdā digdhe tasya u eva uktaḥ an atidāhāya
translated: The significance of that has been explained. It is besmeared with clay, for that (has been) explained. Moreover, for the sake of non-burning.

analyzed: atha atas sampad eva
translated: Now, then, of the complete (sacrificial essence).

original: āsando cokhā ca śikyaṃ ca rukbhapāśaścāgniśca rukbhaśca
analyzed: āsandaḥ ca ukhā ca śikyam ca rukbha pāśaḥ ca agniḥ ca rukbhaḥ ca
translated: The stool, the pan, the sling, the hook-cord, the fire, and the hook,

analyzed: tat ṣaṭ ṣaṭ ṛtavaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ saṃvatsaraḥ gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā
translated: that makes six. The six seasons are a year, the year is Agni. As great as Agni is, as great as is his measure,

analyzed: tāvat tat bhavati iṇḍve tat aṣṭau aṣṭa akṣarā gāyatrī gāyatraḥ gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya
translated: so great does this become. The two balls (of clay) make eight. The Gayatri has eight syllables. Agni is connected with the Gayatri. As great as Agni is, as great as is his measure,

analyzed: mātrā tāvat tat bhavati
translated: so great does this become.

analyzed: atha sarva sampad
translated: Now, then, of the complete (sacrificial essence).

original: catvāraḥ pādāścatvāryanūcyāni śikyaṃ ca rukbhapāśaśca yadu kiṃ
analyzed: catvāraḥ pādāḥ catvāri anūcyāni śikyam ca rukbha pāśaḥ ca yat u kim
translated: The four feet, the four anucya verses, the sling, and the hook-cord, whatever rope

original: ca rajjavyaṃ śikyaṃ tadanūkhāgnī rukbhastattrayodaśa trayodaśa māsāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ
analyzed: ca rajjavyam śikyam tat anu ukhā agniḥ rukbhaḥ tat trayodaśa trayodaśa māsāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: the sling is, that is the anukara. The fire is the hook. That makes thirteen. The thirteen months are a year.

analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ gniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvat tat bhavati
translated: The year is Agni. As great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, so great does this become.

analyzed: tam tiṣṭhan pratimuñcate
translated: He fastens it while standing.

original: asau vā āditya eṣa rukbhastiṣṭhatīva vā asāvādityo 'tho
analyzed: asau vai ādityaḥ eṣa rukbhaḥ tiṣṭhati iva vai asau ādityaḥ
translated: This hook is yonder sun. Yonder sun, as it were, stands.

original: tiṣṭhanvai vīryavattara udaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhaṃstasyokto bandhuḥ / / /🔽dṛśāno rukbha urvyā vyadyauditi /
analyzed: tiṣṭhan vai vīryavattaraḥ udaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhan tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ  dṛśānaḥ rukbhaḥ urvyā vyadyaut iti
translated: Standing, indeed, he is more powerful. Standing with his face to the north-east, the significance of this has been explained.🔽'The bright one hath shone, hath spread over the wide earth.'

analyzed: dṛśyamānaḥ hi eṣa rukbhaḥ urvyāḥ vidyotate
translated: For this bright one, indeed, shines, and spreads over the wide earth, when seen.

original: durmarṣamāyuḥ śriye rucāna iti durmaraṃ vā etasyāyuḥ śriyo eṣa rocate 'gniramṛto
analyzed: durmarṣam āyuḥ śriye rucānaḥ iti durmaram vai etasya āyuḥ śriyā u eṣa rocate gniḥ amṛtaḥ
translated: 'The life that is hard to bear, shining for glory,'--for this (Agni) shines for that life and glory which is hard to bear;--'Agni hath become immortal by the vital airs,'

analyzed: abhavat vayobhiḥ iti sarvaiḥ vai eṣa vayobhiḥ amṛtaḥ bhavat yat enam dyauḥ ajanayat iti
translated: 'by all the vital airs,'--for by all the vital airs he (Agni) has become immortal;--'when the sky brought him forth,'

original: dyaurvā etamajanayatsuretā iti suretā hyeṣā yasyā eṣa retaḥ / / /
analyzed: dyauḥ vai etam ajanayat su retāḥ iti su retāḥ hi eṣā yasyāḥ eṣa retaḥ
translated: for the sky brought him forth;--'the well-impregnated,'--for well-impregnated indeed is that (sky) from which he (Agni) is the seed.

analyzed: atha enam iṇḍvābhyām parigṛhṇāti
translated: He then encloses him with the two balls (of clay).

original: naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe ityahorātre vai🔽naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe dhāpayete śiśumekaṃ samīcī iti yadvai kiṃ🔽cāhorātrayostenaitameva samīcī dhāpayete dyāvākṣāmā rukbho antarvibhātīti
analyzed: nakta uṣāsā samanasā virūpe iti ahar rātre vai  nakta uṣāsā samanasā virūpe dhāpayete śiśum ekam samīcī iti yat vai kim  ca ahar rātrayoḥ tena etam eva samīcī dhāpayete dyāvākṣāmā rukbhaḥ antar vibhāti iti
translated: 'Night and Dawn, of one mind, of different forms,'--Night and Dawn, doubtless, are the day and night;🔽'of one mind, of different forms,'--they both nourish this one child together;--'the bright one shines between the sky and the earth,'

original: harannetadyajurjapatīme vai dyāvāpṛthivī dyāvākṣāmā te eṣa yannantarā vibhāti
analyzed: haran etat yajuḥ japati ime vai dyāvāpṛthivī dyāvākṣāmā te eṣa yan antarā vibhāti
translated: he mutters this Yagus, taking (the balls of clay) along: the sky and the earth, doubtless, are the sky and the earth; and that which shines between them is this (Agni).

original: tasmādetaddharanyajurjapati devā agniṃ dhārayandraviṇodā iti parigṛhya nidadhāti
analyzed: tasmāt etat haran yajuḥ japati devāḥ agnim dhārayan draviṇaḥ dāḥ iti parigṛhya nidadhāti
translated: Therefore he murmurs this Yagus, 'The gods, the givers of wealth, O Agni, hold thee;' having taken hold of it, he puts it down.

original: prāṇā vai devā draviṇodāsta etamagra evamadhārayaṃstairevainametaddhārayati / / /
analyzed: prāṇāḥ vai devāḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ te etam agre evam adhārayan taiḥ eva enam etat dhārayati
translated: The gods, the givers of wealth, are the vital airs; they held him in the beginning in this way; with them he thus holds him.

analyzed: atha śikya pāśam pratimuñcate
translated: He then fastens on the sling.

original: viśvā rūpāṇi pratimuñcatekavirityasau vā ādityaḥ🔽kavirviśvā rūpā śikyam prāsāvīdbhadraṃ dvipade catuṣpada ityudyanvā eṣa dvipade
analyzed: viśvā rūpāṇi pratimuñcata ikaviḥ iti asau vai ādityaḥ  kaviḥ viśvā rūpā śikyam prāsāvīt bhadram dvipade catuṣpade iti udyan vai eṣa dvipade
translated: 'The sage assumes all forms,' (with these words) he fastens on the sling; the sage is yonder sun;🔽the sling is all forms; 'he has bestowed good fortune on bipeds and quadrupeds,' (with these words) he fastens on the sling; rising, he bestows good fortune on bipeds and quadrupeds.

original: catuṣpade ca bhadram prasauti vi nākamakhyatsavitā vareṇya iti svargo vai loko🔽nākastameṣa udyannevānuvipaśyanyanu prayāṇamuṣaso virājatītyuṣā vā agre
analyzed: catuṣpade ca bhadram prasauti vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyaḥ iti svargaḥ vai lokaḥ  nākaḥ tam eṣaḥ udyan eva anuvipaśyan anu prayāṇam uṣasaḥ virājati iti uṣāḥ vai agre
translated: 'Savitri has disclosed the vault, the excellent one,' (with these words) he fastens on the sling; the vault is the heavenly world;🔽rising, he looks along it.🔽'Following the course of the dawns, he shines,' (with these words) he fastens on the sling; the dawn shines first;

original: vyucati tasyā eṣa vyuṣṭiṃ virājannanūdeti / / /🔽athainamato vikṛtyā vikaroti /🔽idamevaitadretaḥ siktaṃ vikaroti tasmādyaunau retaḥ
analyzed: vyucati tasyāḥ eṣa vyuṣṭim virājan anūdeti  atha enam atas vikṛtyā vikaroti  idam eva etat retaḥ siktam vikaroti tasmāt yaunau retaḥ
translated: rising, he shines after its shining, shining brilliantly.🔽He then fashions it out of this (clay) by modification.

analyzed: siktam vikriyate  suparṇaḥ si garutmān iti
translated: He fashions it out of this (clay) by modification, out of the seed that has been infused; therefore the seed that has been infused is modified in the womb.

analyzed: vīryam vai suparṇaḥ
translated: 'Thou art the bird, the eagle,' (with these words) he fashions it; the bird is vigour;

original: garutmānvīryamevainametadabhisaṃskaroti trivṛtte śira iti trivṛtamasya stomaṃ śiraḥ
analyzed: garutmān vīryam eva enam etat abhisaṃskaroti trivṛt te śiraḥ iti trivṛtam asya stomam śiraḥ
translated: He makes it of three stories; he thereby makes the Trivrit Stoma its head.

original: karoti gāyatraṃ cakṣuriti gāyatraṃ cakṣuḥ karoti bṛhadrathantare pakṣāviti
analyzed: karoti gāyatram cakṣuḥ iti gāyatram cakṣuḥ karoti bṛhat rathantare pakṣau iti
translated: He makes the Gayatri its eye; he thereby makes the Gayatri its eye. He makes the Brihat and Rathantara its wings;

original: bṛhadrathantare pakṣau karoti stoma ātmeti stomamātmānaṃ karoti pañcaviṃśaṃ
analyzed: bṛhat rathantare pakṣau karoti stomaḥ ātmā iti stomam ātmānam karoti pañcaviṃśam
translated: he thereby makes the Brihat and Rathantara its wings. He makes the Stoma its body; he thereby makes the Stoma its body. He makes the Pañchavimsa

original: candāṃsyaṅgānīti candāṃsi vā etasyāṅgāni yajūṃṣi nāmeti yadenamagnirityācakṣate
analyzed: candāṃsi aṅgāni iti candāṃsi vai etasya aṅgāni yajūṃṣi nāma iti yat enam agniḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: the limbs; the metres are its limbs. He makes the Yajus its name; in that they call him Agni,

original: tadasya yajūṃṣi nāma sāma te tanūrvāmadevyamityātmā vai tanūrātmā te
analyzed: tat asya yajūṃṣi nāma sāma te tanūḥ vāmadevyam iti ātmā vai tanūḥ ātmā te
translated: that is his Yajus name. He makes the Vamadevya its body; the body is the self; he thereby says, 'The Vamadevya is your body.'

analyzed: tanūḥ vāmadevyam iti etat yajñāyajñiyam pucam iti yajñāyajñiyam pucam karoti
translated: He makes the Yajnayajniya its tail; he thereby makes the Yajnayajniya its tail.

original: dhiṣṇyāḥ śaphā iti dhiṣṇayirvā eṣo 'smiṃloke pratiṣṭhitaḥ suparṇo 'si garutmāndivaṃ
analyzed: dhiṣṇyāḥ śaphāḥ iti dhiṣṇayiḥ vai eṣaḥ u smin loke pratiṣṭhitaḥ suparṇaḥ si garutmān divam
translated: He makes the Dhishnyas its hooves; he thereby establishes it in this world on the Dhishnyas. He says, 'Thou art the bird Garuda; go to heaven,

original: gaca svaḥ pateti tadenaṃ suparṇaṃ garutmantaṃ kṛtvāha devāngaca svargaṃ lokam
analyzed: gaca svar pata iti tat enam suparṇam garutmantam kṛtvā āha devān gaca svargam lokam
translated: O lord of light'; having made it the bird Garuda, he says, 'Go to the gods, to the heavenly world,

analyzed: pata iti
translated: O lord.'

original: taṃ vā etam / atra pakṣapucavantaṃ vikaroti yādṛgvai yonau reto vikriyate
analyzed: tam vai etam atra pakṣapucavantam vikaroti yādṛś vai yonau retaḥ vikriyate
translated: He now makes him (Agni) assume that form with wings and tail. For whatever form the seed assumes in the womb,

analyzed: tādṛś jāyate tat yat etam atra pakṣa pucavantam vikaroti tasmāt eṣaḥ mutra
translated: in that form it is born. In that he now makes him assume that form with wings and tail, therefore he is born yonder

analyzed: pakṣa pucavān jāyate
translated: with wings and tail.

original: taṃ haike / etayā vikṛtyābhimantryānyāṃ citiṃ cinvanti droṇacitaṃ vā rathacakracitaṃ
analyzed: tam ha eke etayā vikṛtyā abhimantrya anyām citim cinvanti droṇa citam vā ratha cakra citam
translated: Now some, having made him assume that form, build another altar, either a Dronacit (altar), or a Rathacakracit (altar),

original: vā kaṅkacitaṃ vā praugacitaṃ vobhayataḥ praugaṃ vā samuhyapurīṣaṃ vā na tathā🔽kuryādyathā pakṣapucavantaṃ garbham parivṛścettādṛktattasmādenaṃ
analyzed: vā kaṅka citam vā prauga citam vā ubhayatas praugam vā samuhya purīṣam vā na tathā  kuryāt yathā pakṣa pucavantam garbham parivṛścet tādṛś tat tasmāt enam
translated: or a Kankacit (altar), or a Praugacit (altar), or a Ubhayataspraug (altar), or a Samuhapuriesa (altar). Let him not do so,🔽for it would be as if he were to surround the embryo with wings and tail. Therefore let him build it

analyzed: suparṇa citam eva cinuyāt
translated: as a Suprnachit (altar).

analyzed: tam etayā vikṛtyā
translated: Now he makes him assume that form.

original: ita ūrdhvam prāñcam pragṛhṇātyasau vā āditya eṣo 'gniramuṃ🔽tadādityamita ūrdhvam prāñcaṃ dadhāti tasmādasāvāditya ita ūrdhvaḥ prāṅ dhīyate🔽parobāhu pragṛhṇāti parobāhu hyeṣa ito 'thainamupāvaharati
analyzed: itas ūrdhvam prāñcam pragṛhṇāti asau vai ādityaḥ eṣaḥ gniḥ amum  tat ādityam itas ūrdhvam prāñcam dadhāti tasmāt asau ādityaḥ itas ūrdhvaḥ prāṅ dhīyate  parobāhu pragṛhṇāti parobāhu hi eṣaḥ itas tha enam upāvaharati
translated: From here upwards he takes it forwards and eastwards. This Agni is yonder sun;🔽he thus places yonder sun upwards and forwards; therefore yonder sun is placed upwards and forwards.🔽He takes it with a long arm, for it is at a long distance from here. He then brings it down;

analyzed: tam upāvahṛtya uparinābhi dhārayati tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ
translated: and having brought it down, he holds it above the navel. The significance of this has been explained.

analyzed: atha viṣṇukramān kramate
translated: He then strides the Vishnu steps.

analyzed: etat vai devāḥ viṣṇuḥ bhūtvā imān lokān akramanta
translated: For the gods, having become Vishnu, strode these worlds.

analyzed: yat viṣṇuḥ bhūtvā akramanta tasmāt viṣṇukramāḥ tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ
translated: In that they strode having become Vishnu, therefore they are Vishnu steps. In the same way the sacrificer,

analyzed: viṣṇuḥ bhūtvā imān lokān kramate  sa yaḥ sa viṣṇuḥ yajñaḥ saḥ
translated: having become Vishnu, strides these worlds.🔽Now that Vishnu is this sacrifice.

original: sa yaḥ sa yajño 'yameva sa yo 'yamagnirukhāyāmetameva
analyzed: sa yaḥ sa yajñaḥ yam eva sa yaḥ yam agniḥ ukhāyām etam eva
translated: And that sacrifice is this very fire in the wood. Having made this

analyzed: tat devāḥ ātmānam kṛtvā imān lokān akramanta tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ etam eva ātmānam
translated: their self, the gods strode these worlds. In the same way the sacrificer, having made this very self,

analyzed: kṛtvā imān lokān kramate
translated: strides these worlds.

analyzed: udaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhan
translated: Standing with his face to the north-east.

analyzed: etat vai tat prajāpatiḥ viṣṇukramaiḥ udaṅ prāṅ tiṣṭhan prajāḥ asṛjata
translated: For that is what Prajapati did, standing with his face to the north-east, having become Vishnu, he created the people.

analyzed: tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ viṣṇukramaiḥ udaṅ tiṣṭhan prajāḥ sṛjate  viṣṇoḥ kramo si iti
translated: In the same way the sacrificer, standing with his face to the north, having become Vishnu, creates the people.

original: viṣṇurhi bhūtvā kramate sapatnaheti sapatnānhātra hanti
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ hi bhūtvā kramate sapatna hā iti sapatnān ha atra hanti
translated: He says, You are the step of Vishnu. For he strides having become Vishnu. For the enemy, he says; for he slays the enemies here.

original: gāyatraṃ canda āroheti gāyatraṃ canda ārohati pṛthivīmanu vikramasveti
analyzed: gāyatram candaḥ āroha iti gāyatram candaḥ ārohati pṛthivīm anu vikramasva iti
translated: Mount the metre Gayatri, he says; he mounts the metre Gayatri. Stride along the earth, he says.

original: pṛthivīmanu vikramate praharati pādaṃ kramata ūrdhvamagnimudgṛhṇātyūrdhvo hi
analyzed: pṛthivīm anu vikramate praharati pādam kramate ūrdhvam agnim udgṛhṇāti ūrdhvaḥ hi
translated: He strides along the earth, he strikes the ground with his foot, he lifts up the fire upwards, for upwards

analyzed: rohati
translated: He strides along the earth, he strikes the foot, he strides upwards, he grasps the fire upwards, for he ascends upwards.

original: viṣṇoḥ / kramo 'sīti viṣṇurhi bhūtvā kramate 'bhimātihetyabhimātīrhātra hanti🔽traiṣṭubhaṃ canda āroheti traiṣṭubhaṃ canda ārohatyantarikṣamanu🔽vikramasvetyantarikṣamanu vikramata praharati pādaṃ kramata
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ si iti viṣṇuḥ hi bhūtvā kramate bhimāti hā iti abhimātīḥ ha atra hanti  traiṣṭubham candaḥ āroha iti traiṣṭubham candaḥ ārohati antarikṣam anu  vikramasva iti antarikṣam anu vikramata praharati pādam kramata
translated: The step of Vishnu thou art, for he strides as Vishnu. Smiter of foes, for he here indeed strikes away foes.🔽He mounts the Tristubh metre, for he mounts the Tristubh metre. Along the atmosphere stride, he says; along the atmosphere he strides.

analyzed: ūrdhvam agnim udgṛhṇāti ūrdhvaḥ hi rohati  viṣṇoḥ kramo si iti
translated: He strikes the foot, he strides upwards, he grasps the fire upwards, for he ascends upwards.

original: viṣṇurhi bhūtvā kramate 'rātīyato hantetyarātīyato hātra hanti
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ hi bhūtvā kramate rātīyataḥ hantā iti a rātīyataḥ ha atra hanti
translated: The step of Vishnu thou art, for he strides as Vishnu. Smiter of foes, for he here indeed strikes away foes.

original: jāgataṃ canda āroheti jāgataṃ canda ārohati divamanu vikramasveti divamanu
analyzed: jāgatam cande āroha iti jāgatam cande ārohati divam anu vikramasva iti divam anu
translated: He mounts the Jagati metre, for he mounts the Jagati metre. Along the sky stride, he says; along the sky he strides.

original: vikramate praharati pādaṃ kramata ūrdhvamagnimudgṛhṇātyūrdhvo hi rohati / / /🔽viṣṇoḥ kramo 'sīti /
analyzed: vikramate praharati pādam kramate ūrdhvam agnim udgṛhṇāti ūrdhvaḥ hi rohati  viṣṇoḥ kramo si iti
translated: He strikes the foot, he strides upwards, he grasps the fire upwards, for he ascends upwards.

original: viṣṇurhi bhūtvā kramate śatrūyato hanteti śatruyato hātra
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ hi bhūtvā kramate śatrūyataḥ hantā iti śatruyataḥ ha atra
translated: The step of Vishnu thou art, for he strides as Vishnu. Smiter of foes, for he here indeed strikes away foes.

original: hantyānuṣṭubhaṃ canda ārohetyānuṣṭubhaṃ canda ārohati diśo 'nu vikramasveti
analyzed: hanti ānuṣṭubham cande āroha iti ānuṣṭubham cande ārohati diśaḥ nu vikramasva iti
translated: 'Mount the metre Anushtubh', he says; he mounts the metre Anushtubh. 'Stride along the quarters', he says;

original: sarvā diśo 'nu vīkṣate na praharati pādaṃ🔽nedimāṃlokānatipraṇaśyānītyūrdhvamevāgnimudgṛhṇāti saṃ hyārohati / / /
analyzed: sarvāḥ diśaḥ nu vīkṣate na praharati pādam  na id imān lokān atipraṇaśyāni iti ūrdhvam eva agnim udgṛhṇāti sam hi ārohati
translated: he looks along all the quarters. He does not strike the foot,🔽lest he should pass beyond these worlds. Upwards only he takes the fire, for he mounts upwards.

analyzed: atha enam iti pragṛhṇāti
translated: Then he takes hold of it with 'O Agni, come hither.'

original: etadvai devā akāmayanta parjanyo rūpaṃ syāmeti ta🔽etenātmanā parjanyo rūpamabhavaṃstathaivaitadyajamāna etenātmanā parjanyo
analyzed: etat vai devāḥ akāmayanta parjanyaḥ rūpam syāma iti te  etena ātmanā parjanyaḥ rūpam abhavan tathā eva etat yajamānaḥ etena ātmanā parjanyaḥ
translated: The gods then desired, 'May we be of the form of Parjanya.'

analyzed: rūpam bhavati

translated: 'Agni hath cried, as it were, the sky thundering,'🔽for Parjanya, as it were, thunders. 'The plants, the dry, he anoints, uniting them,'🔽for Parjanya, as it were, anoints the dry plants, uniting them.

original: rerihadvīrudhaḥ samañjanniti kṣamā vai parjanyo rerihyamāṇo vīrudhaḥ samanakti
analyzed: rerihat vīrudhaḥ samañjan iti kṣamā vai parjanyaḥ rerihyamāṇaḥ vīrudhaḥ samanakti

analyzed: atha enam upāvaharati

translated: For this (Agni) rises upwards with the sap and the support of this world;🔽for Agni is the sap and the support of this world. If it were to be that only,

analyzed: rasam upajīvanam dadhāti

analyzed: yat u eva pratyavarohati

analyzed: etat vai etat imān lokān itas ūrdhvaḥ rohati sa sa parāṅ iva roha
translated: For this (Agni) rises upwards from these worlds, and rises even beyond;

analyzed: yat evam pratyavarohati

analyzed: etat vai etat imān lokān itas ūrdhvaḥ jayati sa sa parāṅ iva jaya
translated: For this (Agni) conquers these worlds, rising upwards, and conquers even beyond;

analyzed: yaḥ vai parāṅ iva jayati anye vai tasya jitam anvavasyanti atha yaḥ ubhayathā jayati tasya

analyzed: agne bhyāvartin  abhi mā nivartasva agne aṅgiraḥ punar ūrjā saha rayyā iti etena mā

analyzed: sarveṇa abhinivartasva iti etat catur kṛtvas pratyavarohati catuḥ hi kṛtvas ūrdhvaḥ rohati  tat yāvatkṛtvas ūrdhvaḥ rohati tāvatkṛtvas pratyavarohati tam upāvahṛtya uparinābhi
translated: return to me, O Agni, O Angiras, again with food and wealth. With this (verse) he descends four times; for four times he ascends upwards.

analyzed: dhārayati tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ  atha enam abhimantrayate  āyuḥ vai agniḥ āyuḥ eva etat ātman dhatte ā tvā ahārṣam iti ā  hi enam haranti antarabhūḥ iti āyuḥ eva etat ātman dhatte
translated: As many times as he ascends upwards, so many times he descends. Having brought it down, he holds it above the navel. The meaning of this has been explained.

analyzed: dhruvaḥ tiṣṭha avicācaliḥ iti āyuḥ eva etat dhruvam antarātman dhatte viśastvā sarvā
translated: He then addresses it with (the verse), 'Agni is life; verily he lays life into his own self. I have brought thee hither,' for they bring it hither. original: vāñcantvityannaṃ vai viśo 'nnaṃ tvā sarvaṃ vāñcatvityetanmā

original: atha śikyapāśaṃ ca rukbhapāśaṃ conmuñcate /🔽vāruṇo vai pāśo varuṇapāśādeva🔽tatpramucyate vāruṇya 'rcā svenaiva tadātmanā svayā devatayā🔽varuṇapāśātpramucyata uduttamaṃ varuṇa pāśamasmadavādhamaṃ vi madhyamaṃ

translated: He then unties the sling-band and the hook-band.🔽The sling-band, doubtless, is Varuna's noose: from Varuna's noose he thus delivers him. original: śrathāyeti yathaiva yajustathā bandhurathā vayamāditya vrate tavānāgaso aditaye🔽syāmetīyaṃ vā aditiranāgasastubhyaṃ cāsyai syāmetyetat / / /🔽athainamiti pragṛhṇāti /

translated: 'Loosen thou the highest, loosen the lowest, loosen the middle (band of Varuna),' thus (he says),--as the text so the meaning;--'and we, O Âditya, in thy law, free from sin, may we be with Aditi,'--Aditi, doubtless, is this (earth): 'free from sin may we be to thee and to her,' this is what he says.🔽He then takes hold of him (Soma) with (the formula), 'This (I take) for the gods, this for the men;' for in the beginning, indeed, he (Soma) was made up of all the gods, and of all the vital airs. Now, when he is pressed, he is made up of the gods of the sacrifice: he thus takes hold of him as being made up of all the vital airs.

original: etadvā enamado vikṛtyeta ūrdhvam prāñcam pragṛhṇāti taṃ🔽tata iti pragṛhṇāti tadyattāvadevābhaviṣyadatra haivaiṣa vyaraṃsyatātha yadenamiti🔽pragṛhṇāti tasmādeṣa itītvātheti punaraiti / / /

analyzed: pragṛhṇāti parobāhu hi eṣaḥ itas

analyzed: tha enam upāvaharati imām eva etat pratiṣṭhām abhipratyaiti asyām eva etat pratiṣṭhāyām
translated: Then he lowers him; verily he thereby goes to this support; on this support

translated: 'The guest of creatures, the guest of the house,'--that is, 'the uneven guest,'--'the guest of men,'--the guest of men doubtless is the breath, the man, the human being;--that (Agni) is the breath which is among men;--'the guest of the choice,'--for he is present in every choice;--'the guest of truth,'--that is, 'the guest of the true;'--'the guest of the all,'--for he is present in every all;--'the guest of the waters,'--for he is the guest of the waters;--'the guest of the cattle,'--for he is the guest of the cattle;--'the guest of the holy order,'--that is, 'the guest of truth;'--'the guest of the mountain,'--for he is the guest of the mountain;--'the guest of truth,'--

translated: They amount to nine.

analyzed: mātrā tāvat tat bhavati
translated: The quarters are nine, Agni is the quarters, the vital airs are nine, Agni is the vital airs; as great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, so great does this become.

original: atha prāyaścittī karoti /🔽sarvebhyo vā eṣa etaṃ kāmebhya ādhatte tadyadevāsyātra
analyzed: atha prāyaścittī karoti  sarvebhyaḥ vai eṣaḥ etam kāmebhyaḥ ādhatte tat yat eva asya atra
translated: Then he performs the expiation.🔽He sets it up for all his desires; whatever of his desires is cut off

analyzed: kāmānām vyavacidyate gnau apaḥ bhyavahriyamāṇe tat eva etat saṃtanoti
translated: when the fire is carried away in the water, that he thereby joins together.

original: saṃdadhātyubhe prāyaścittī karoti ye evāgnāvanugate tasyokto bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: saṃdadhāti ubhe prāyaścittī karoti ye eva agnau anugate tasya uktaḥ bandhuḥ
translated: He joins the two, he performs the expiation. The significance of that is explained where the fire is carried around.

original: tāni daśa bhavanti /🔽daśākṣarā virāḍvirāḍagnirdeśa diśo diśo 'gnirdaśa prāṇāḥ prāṇā
analyzed: tāni daśa bhavanti  daśa akṣarā virāj virāj agniḥ diśaḥ diśaḥ gniḥ daśa prāṇāḥ prāṇā
translated: Those (bricks) are ten.

analyzed: agniḥ yāvān agniḥ yāvatī asya mātrā tāvat tat bhavati
translated: The Viraj has ten syllables, Agni is the Viraj, the quarters are Agni, the quarters are the ten vital airs, the vital airs are Agni. As great as Agni is, as great as is his measure, so great does this become.
